title: [BEAM-12653] Fix container cleanup for Java Dataflow tests
body:
I think the various ValidateRunner V2 Dataflow tests are deleting images out from under each other. What I think is happening: 1. Test 1 launches, pushes `gcr.io/.../java:$TIME_TAG1` with digest `sha256:$digest` 2. Test 2 launches with no change in repo, pushes `gcr.io/.../java:$TIME_TAG2` which has the same digest `sha256:$digest`. 3. Test 1 finishes, runs deletion with `--force-delete-images` on `gcr.io/.../java:$TIME_TAG1`, which deletes all associated tags/images for `$digest` (including `gcr.io/.../java:$TIME_TAG2`). 4. Test 2 starts to fail. New strategy untags the image, and then runs a cleanup script that removes any images that aren't tagged, so we don't delete an image by tag with multiple tags, and we run less risk of cleaning up a image in use (tests only use tagged image URLs). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-12399] Move CPython license to own file.
body:
In order to resolve BEAM-12399 (Beam Go SDK docs can't be displayed on the standard GoDoc site pkg.go.dev) we need to separate out the CPython license stack from the other licenses which apply more broadly. * Moves that license text from LICENSE to LICENSE.python * Ensures the LICENSE.python file is also copied to the Python SDK distribution images. Per https://github.com/golang/go/issues/45095, and #46291 the issue is that the license not particularly compatible, so adding it as a recognized license is apparently not the way forward. However, as the license only needs to be posted with distributions of cpython, it largely only needs to go into the Python SDK container(s). Since pkg.go.dev must be conservative about what it checks for LICENSE we can't pare down or filter what the site picks up (eg. a LICENSE.golang or a LICENSE in the sdks/go subdirectory file would only be added to whats in the root LICENSE, not supercede it). However, pkg.go.dev doesn't look at other LICENSE files for particular languages, hence the new file. The way we're referring to the LICENSE.python sidecar file is also acceptable to Apache Legal https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LEGAL-582 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here @aaltay @tysonjh @ibzib This fixes the broken tab experience on the Java Quickstart page. We can now create tabbed runner and shell examples using the `{{ shell lang }}` ![Screen Shot 2021-07-19 at 4 36 43 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672572/126240710-b25f710b-a786-4c1f-9f7d-665861c3b5bf.png) and `{{runner lang }}` ![Screen Shot 2021-07-19 at 4 37 25 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672572/126240743-45b1b8f4-39f9-4b45-b9f6-b71dcf7315ba.png) shortcodes, respectively. title: [BEAM-12388] Add caching to deferred dataframes
body:
This adds caching to any dataframes using the InteractiveRuner. The algorithm works by modifying a DataFrame expression tree in-place. Any expressions in the tree that have a corresponding cached PCollection are replaced with PlaceHolderExpressions. These expressions are then turned into PCollections and are pruned when run with the InteractiveRunner. This was created from https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15146. See that PR for the code review. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6516] Fixes race condition in RabbitMqIO causing duplicate acks
body:
RabbitMqIO.java uses ArrayList to store sessionIds which is not thread safe and thus causes duplicate acks in finalizeCheckpoint method. This leads to the channel getting closed. ArrayList is replaced with ConcurrentLinkedQueue which ensures that only one thread can process a sessionId for a channel. Error message: `#method(reply-code=406, reply-text=PRECONDITION_FAILED - unknown delivery tag 1, class-id 60, method-id=80)` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9615] Update Beam Go row coder to more completely handle schema interfaces
body:
Update Beam Go row coder to correctly handle schema interface providers for struct fields, map keys/values, and slice elements. Consider the following `MyStruct` and `MyParDo` and assume I have implemented a schema provider for `encoding/gob`. ``` type MyStruct struct { // ... } func (ms *MyStruct) GobEncode() ([]byte, error) { // ... } func (ms *MyStruct) GobDecode(b []byte) error { // ... } type MyData struct { MyStruct MyStruct } ``` If I encode and decode `MyData` using `beam.NewElementEncoder` and `beam.NewElementDecoder`, the result will be incorrect as Beam Go will fail to realize that `MyStruct` supports gob and ignore any unexported fields. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12388] Add caching to deferred dataframes
body:
This adds caching to any dataframes using the InteractiveRuner. The algorithm works by modifying a DataFrame expression tree in-place. Any expressions in the tree that have a corresponding cached PCollection are replaced with PlaceHolderExpressions. These expressions are then turned into PCollections and are pruned when run with the InteractiveRunner. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-2914] Add TimestampPrefixingWindowCoder as beam:coder:custom_window:v1.
body:
Add a new common standard coder beam:coder:custom_window:v1. The coder encodes arbitrary bounded window by prefixing the max timestamp to its encoded form using the window's registered coder. e.g.: max_timestamp encoded_window_bytes The idea is that, any arbitrary window extending bounded window must have max timestamp defined and runner only needs to know the max timestamp when processing trigger timers. The encoded bytes using the original custom window's registered coder can be used transparently on runner side as the identity of the window. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12665] Add option in ReadAll Transforms to add filename to the output
body:
Adds option to return filename when reading files with `ReadAll` transforms. It does the same as [`ReadFromTextWithFilename`](https://beam.apache.org/releases/pydoc/2.30.0/apache_beam.io.textio.html#apache_beam.io.textio.ReadFromTextWithFilename) but works with `All` transforms (i.e., don't need be at the start of the pipeline). It also allows other `ReadAll` transforms like `AvroIO`, `ParquetIO`, `TFRecordIO`. The reason behind adding this feature is I have gotten use case from Beam users that needed to read files in parallel but be able to aggregate file by file after some transforms. This is not currently available and would require complex workarounds with `FileSystems`. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-11994] Update BigQueryStorageStreamSource and BigQueryServicesImpl to capture API_REQUEST_COUNT metrics/errors for storage API reads
body:
[BEAM-11994] Update BigQueryStorageStreamSource and BigQueryServicesImpl to capture API_REQUEST_COUNT metrics/errors for storage API reads - Collects all requests and errors related to API calls for Reading from BigQuery directly. i.e. the methods in BigQueryReadClient. This is done in BigQueryServicesImpl: createReadSession, readRows, splitReadStream. As well as BigQueryStorageStreamReader.readNextRecord() - Also contains a parser for BigQuery table strings formats, into TableRef. See BigQueryUtils.toTableReference. In order to populate the labels on the metric. - Adds methods to BigQuery StorageClient and StorageClientImpl so that the calls will have the bigquery table id when creating the metrics - Also contains changes to BigueryStorageSourceBase, BigQueryTableSource BigQueryQuerySource to get the tableID without trying to call the APIs to get the table. This was introduced, because when running a pipeline against a non existing table. NullPointerExceptions were thrown. With this change a proper NOT_FOUND exception is shown to the user and collected in the API_REQUEST_COUNT metrics. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution!
